alert.note: Alert for San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 8:05AM MDT until April 17 at 4:12PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River Above Pecos affecting San Miguel County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. Rises beyond 5 feet will result in impacts immediately near the river bank and along private bridges on the water ways. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Pecos River above Pecos. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, THE FAST FLOW IN THE UPPER PECOS IS A THREAT TO PROPERTY DUE TO THE EFFECTS OF BANK EROSION ALLOWING RIVER WATER TO APPROACH HOMES AND CABINS NEAREST THE RIVER. PRIVATE BRIDGES OVER THE UPPER PECOS COULD LOCALLY AGGRAVATE FLOODING AS DEBRIS ACCUMULATES ALONG THE UPSTREAM SIDES OF BRIDGES. FURTHER WATER LEVEL RISES MAY MAKE PRIVATE BRIDGES UNSAFE TO CROSS AND ISOLATE RESIDENTS. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM MDT Friday the stage was 4.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 4.6 feet late Sunday evening. - Action stage is 4.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning around 815 AM MDT.
